titles.title: Relating to the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation organization.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Policy, Trade and Environment.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 103-280, Part I.
Mr. Rostenkowski moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 229.

bill.summary: 6/22/1993--Introduced. Encourages U.S. leadership in the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation organization. Calls on the President, the Secretary of State, and other representatives of the U.S. Government to take the opportunity presented by the scheduled chairing and hosting by the United States of the ministerial meeting of the organization in Seattle, Washington, on November 17 through 19, 1993, to reaffirm the U.S. commitment to make it an effective regional economic organization that reduces barriers to increased intra-regional trade through the harmonization of standards, trade, and investment policies.
